document.title: Utah Core State Standards for English Language Arts and Literacy in History/Social Studies, Science, and Technical Subjects

CBC0177B11DD4F4A8B1DA38454A7382B.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

EB8F3FC1EB3D4D45AFA8EAFF0F1BFD66.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

5BC9FC53D5B040D0BA001D4D865A7CE6.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

9C8F2D581E7B49D4A1B07DDAFA4A47C8.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

8812E54C3C8047F39D8C402602BF12A4.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

1E0BD9C1C0674F098E4816EE469B58A8.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

368AB2A368644442A54A355EE31FB54E.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

289B051CD72546C28CF7FD642B5CCA86.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

7AA4CDB1D8634FDF9F8E527AA5AA49FC.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

8BE010A273B2465BAEA0101D00810907.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

59C8E02EAA0243D2BAB73104CBB9C0BE.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

DCD25F4095B74ECABA03EBD37BCE4683.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

536EE386BE2F400EB798B07319B9DC5B.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

890F1F950C38413FA26E2B7103EA51B6.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

42652AC159B24813AEB3B268AB1E20D6.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

C516160002904F58945A88620304A773.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

12AB2EEFEE2F4DD885A0DAD617B80058.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

17A27DF379234C1D9C17EAB7A56FCF73.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

5FBDD12F5A834EBCB5055C9E0CCB0251.description: With guidance and support, identify and write many upper- and lowercase letters, including those in the student's name.

0D612349CED74816844ABF99739D6D42.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

FCB648CFA969400582D8869E2EDAF23A.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

6F78B66126694E7B946550F6B09301D3.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

218120CEF0AF46BDA99BF5421B333E31.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

3D0843DF254C48F29215F918D73B5F0D.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

D2AD9D2ADCF745E7BE3F9784A04382C3.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

48C06B9DE0124E49822B39C8BC9B5124.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

D9FF4DDF4B3043EFB4F83BECA4B5260B.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language

F59DDE2580DB47D9B9301544DF05FCA3.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

519866D525F847E390AA7417D9517F9F.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

CCB74DFBE411420CABC1478DD25C80E7.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

CB8EC951009C44D2AC8B946EF64838B1.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

C58D4A5D51D54DBFA42361D2DF7084A0.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

C8E5A6E3D7EA41B28C859F76E7103BDC.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

DF91327F755E461687D188EDE932EBEC.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

EC5F6B8B706047ACB376CE1F354013F2.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

30850CC1D9444604991C262533FE35E0.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

BD3EDC2771E0466D93E8604E5819BB85.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

4F4D8023947849B283B0286B15EDA006.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

7EB16EBC177C4D1AA4F40A1AEA425CDF.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

BEBB7B32D0464D62BDF13E2177C3F821.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

D8783A1B4F9B443C915A068694365EEA.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

21394801EC1B4D15B41075C04C1006F1.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening

1BC44D49CD1F49588EEE3C02285B4CCE.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

6B061F9CAAA24B9C8EE541BFE216CF33.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

5B6A6738EA8C456DA486BFF16206534B.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

93FE0BB9B076426185AFE1F01C5457A8.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

5F8D73AB2C014640929E1CB0F5C4EE51.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

A4959EABCA7E4BDDA24B77AFA3115B7D.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

18A58D2AB2C64B68876A089938597E79.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

B41B1480E8ED4EB3A3DDF9AB36612E6F.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is . . .).

8A24AA5C7E9C4E658A5E7EA664AB6EF1.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

9AEA516D9D85489EAA5485FEF8B60F13.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

1B367ABBEBB24D4B8A2595055EAAE7C2.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

DC3A791255A64502A8D67AA900C3A04B.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

4950065F2213430E988129A5A278D0A1.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

572B3D0CEE3D45BE8D1FE27BC94911B5.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

AD513ABC2EAB4EB7B982E7368BD74612.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

7B822F78F24B4CD19BB0D5F06175F98A.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

7D5CFF8CFF664CC1B243A03FC9EAAF88.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

304B1659289044BBACAFE59E7418D306.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

3E5E5F7B54184576AD4CC6AA41E8BE7F.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

0D4BC654B3674762811A7E23D47A01CD.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing

9E7E591EA8734361B31B78D2393A5D84.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

3328DCDFB80B47EE8BC6F40EA563F70F.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

AB88DDBBAC3449F19B1E075F382DC7FB.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

FB9B0ADECED34615B6D4FF50D3A458AF.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

2CBCBD6C17874F4C99514C03CBC5ACE3.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

212C78E3C12C4421900936E389434887.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

0EDF8C0FC6CD44CFA2DDB4CA34808FDC.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

068E30F0D99A4564877BE543AEBF4651.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

A508F4CDCCBD4D358F180F1D9CE16EDC.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

E62CB471CBD64B55A3D8AE3D560EB911.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

28FB7708E5B941939BABB5CC3A50A8D1.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

7146A08FE8694059A2B068B11536F0FD.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

41B10FBD30BD4034914E324176A5B021.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

0E5EEAB219F142CABEF387B02A331E70.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

7BCBCA95FF764AB992605ACFC17DDFE4.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

634A7111D8014D5698A53B9704ADEDF4.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

C0A91A689B834AF5B997B45DB26D91FF.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

6D8A8C6DDE854D01B917EA28440AB93B.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

A86352706CE04E13B79DFB7522AB8A6E.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

7E0865E827DE45038E8831166479953E.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

2817B8B255304968A89860ACECD4400E.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

F8F677E1912B47678921847E0978E164.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

0CD69293E41C45B3A40270932692A4B3.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

A7BFA009A47A4B858ED201D6F978F782.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

AD9AAA17C80742BC8FD283908ABC257C.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

7B89243464D44D9C8F9C3CF4C3ED45D5.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

6D8F11A5E9D549FA951FB0177226391E.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

8BF829BA141A433A999A677FF42C0B04.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

F91DB4BB34DB463DB8DB16C0C0B96526.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

FA10ED3EE7FA4DFDB79120E9B8D701BA.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

6A823161C195423FB8354D485A031E6B.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

71C11D5C706348DCB664737BAE2CA7C3.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

4249D6982F0E4AB5ABA9C5348B8933F9.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

1989E59B1F1A42CFA3770890FC19FBEA.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

6D3125DAE38447F2A83FF8E54916CC93.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

681C5E4ACC314885B1BE8E080E9FAB93.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

CDFB00240CE541CFBD0529F3C76DDF4B.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

B33F3256930340DAAE9A88A466BE091E.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A634FD3B13FA4B80884A5BE1F5CFB9B1.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

B007B09E2496457DA520289B5F855C63.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

95E11A8652E04B21825B9EF8A49460DB.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

427319118B90421B9C7E4B47B0FED666.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

21DA79B7C18A4A2E9D5AF3E6193FDD54.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

01C90648A79E44F18806201C2B79CD39.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

FDFB2D1B25244F9BBE236FE3015893D0.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

FEE2B9F5511141028536F7BF8E508F7F.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

262E1934EF6C42208A5FFB5DD1EC1D7A.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

8F9EE43A3D63442991062DDB4BC71414.description: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Reading
